intro: Draba nemorosa var. stenoloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved winter grass, is a low-growing perennial herb native to temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches heights of 5–20 cm and features basal rosettes of linear to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during late winter to early spring. Its flowering stems are often hairy and bear several flower clusters along their length. This variety is adapted to moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
